Job Posting: 176114 - Position: S26 2026 Summer - Actuarial Analyst (4-16 months) 176114 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/07/2026 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 12/16/2025 03:00 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country RBC (Royal Bank of Canada) Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode 2026 - Summer S26 2026 Summer - Actuarial Analyst (4-16 months) 176114 Co-op Position Mississauga, ON Canada 4 or 8 months To be confirmed Salary Currency CAD Salary Job Description Req ID: R-0000152431 Job Description Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Your application will be reviewed for consideration across multiple positions with responsibilities aligned to those described in this job posting. Please upload your transcript and work term evaluation with your application. What is the opportunity? As an Actuarial Co-op Student, you will receive an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience with real-world business problems, be challenged to resolved complex tasks, and provided with valuable on-the-job trainings. This role will offer you an exciting opportunity to be part of the largest bank owned insurance company in Canada; you will apply, enhance, and develop experience and working knowledge to perform a combination of challenging tasks and operational assignments. RBC Insurance offers a very inclusive team that works cohesively together, which is integral to the success of continuing to grow all lines of business. We commit to formally structured access to leaders across our actuarial teams, and other business areas, to ensure you are learning all aspects of insurance and are prepared for a successful and rewarding career. What will you do? • Learn, influence, and innovate end to end aspects of the business ranging from sales to pricing and valuation to risk & capital. These roles will offer opportunities to gain exposures to all areas of business. • Creating pricing and valuation models for complex and high-impact products from an actuarial perspective including but not limited to asset strategy discussions with RBC Insurance Investment team and liability cash flow management with RBC Risk Management. • Assist in validation of key assumptions, gathering and applying market competition, and using business insights to identify trends/opportunities. • Using software like AXIS, R, SQL and MS Excel to produce and analyze results, communicate findings to respective stakeholders to obtain their approvals. • Develop, maintain, and enhance new and existing tools to better streamline processes. • Collaborate with fellow actuarial and non-actuarial colleagues to achieve success. • Conduct monthly/quarterly valuation reporting, and communicate results and findings to management. • Model and analyze Special Quotes to better serve our clients' needs. Support monthly/quarterly capital measurement analysis and reporting. • Please note: This posting is for a 4, 8, 12 and 16 months Summer 2026 Student placement with a start date of May 2026. Job Requirements What do you need to succeed? Must have • Knowledge of MS Office Suite • Solid technical and analytical skills with strong problem-solving ability • Strong written and verbal communication skills • Highly motivated self-starter and team player Nice to have • Pursuing a university degree in Actuarial Science, Finance, Statistics, or Mathematics • Actuarial exposure/background • 2-3 CAS/SOA exams completed • Previous experience with Moody's/GGY AXIS • Knowledge of IFRS17, predictive analytics and Tableau are definite assets Programing experience in R, VBA and SQL • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: 2026 Summer - Actuarial Analyst (4-16 months) in MISSISSAUGA, Ontario, Canada | Rotational Programs | Internships at RBC | Jobs at RBC Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
